boat.full_description:
Her first owner was Whilloughby John Bean, an East Coast landowner who also owned Clacton Pier and used her as a pleasure boat for the pier. She was registered for fishing in 1905. Frederick Westhorpe Mole (born 1882) of West Mersea fished her as CK46. Frederick was killed when the naval stores ship Industry was torpedoed in the Irish Sea 18 October 1918. After the war she was bought by the Pitt family and fished out of Maldon as MN4 by Alfred and Roy Pitt.

She won the West Mersea Town Cup in 1938. She fished until the 1950s as MN4 when she was taken out of fishing and used as a floating pontoon. David Wager purchased her as a wreck dug from the mud in Essex and re-built her in Tollesbury 1977-1983. He moved her to the Isle of Wight in 1985 and cruised her to Amsterdam and to Brest.

In November 2022 she was purchased by new owners, brought back to West Mersea by lorry and relaunched June 2023.

She now resides in Tollesbury.
boat.name: Skylark
boat.short_description: Built as a pleasure boat for Clacton Pier, she was registered for fishing in 1905 and fished up until the 1950's.
